title: Know this font?
content:
Any ideas on what the name of this colorful font is?

[http://babasonicos.com/](http://web.archive.org/web/20080605060600/http:/babasonicos.com/ "http://babasonicos.com/")

 [‹ Soul Samba Font- PLEASE HELP!](http://web.archive.org/web/20080605060600/http:/typophile.com/node/45954 "Go to previous forum topic") [Blueprint mag fonts ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080605060600/http:/typophile.com/node/45962 "Go to next forum topic")
author: rdubois

comments.content: Looks like someone had some ’fun’ with Gill Sans UltraBold.
I’m pretty sure this isn’t a modified font - I’ve seen it elsewhere (may bon apetit magazine).

Well, there are 1001+ fonts in this style at the moment as it is oh so hip, but have a look at [this list that Stephen Coles compiled](http://web.archive.org/web/20080605060600/http:/www.typophile.com/node/42643) - I am sure you’ll find something you like.

Nonetheless, pretty certain that your mystery font started out as Gill Sans, before it got the ’non-format ’ treatment.

According to [this website](http://web.archive.org/web/20080605060600/http:/cookieface.com.ar/2008/04/08/el-nuevo-disco-de-babasonicos/), the cover illustration (the one on the righthand side, and also the background pattern) is by [Si Scott](http://web.archive.org/web/20080605060600/http:/www.siscottstudio.com/). Maybe he’s also the one that customized the colorful lettering. (Which certainly does look like it could be the work of [Non-Format](http://web.archive.org/web/20080605060600/http:/www.non-format.com/). But I’m with Seb, too.)
Seb and Ricardo - much thanks for the responses and resources. It definitely looks like it could be the work of Non-Format.
TBH i dont think its Non-Format, but i’ve been wrong before ;)
